file_content.text: This was deserved.
Some deals just fall through.
Don't take it personally.
You were way overdue.
More than deserved.
Rule with a clenched fist, you better be prepared to scrap.
Not everybody bows to a Sith.
Trusting in a tool, however useful, was a mistake. The task of delivering the master stroke, I should have reserved for myself.
A galaxy would know: None are beyond my reach. All would cower, or they would burn.
And the Dark Council would see how total victory is achieved.
Even Sith don't get everything they want.
Ambition brought you here.
Rest in peace, Tormen. Just this once.
It's over, be still.
At least they won't have to see how far you missed the mark.
No risk of that now.
You reek of vengeance and... satisfaction. The Supreme Chancellor's death has excited your passions.
Relish it. Experience some small measure of what it is to be Sith.
Now, deliver what I have asked of you.
I got an offer more in line with my work ethic.
I'm only here to void our deal.
I'm afraid you'll have to accept a substitution.
Sorry, change of plans.
I'm done dancing to your tune, Tormen.
I've been waiting for this.
I expected better.
Is it care or squeamishness that brings the Chancellor to me alive? The effect is the same.
Here lies the ruler of the Republic. A ruined old man crumpled at my feet.
Today we have shaken the galaxy to its core. All will know our names, and tremble.
Relish it. There will be other victories, but none this sweet.
The only value I attach to a bounty is what you're willing to pay.
Just another job.
You should have seen him beg.
I enjoyed it, believe me.
I will see the Dark Council bow their heads to me in veneration.
Nothing glorious about slapping around an old man, don't care how important he is.
Hardly a challenge.
The Republic empowers weakness. Crushing it is necessity, if not glory.
You are a valuable asset. Perhaps my most valuable. I will make good use of your talents when I take my place among the Dark Council.
Only if your credits are good.
Mandalore's the only one I gave the privilege of having me on call.
I don't operate at your beck and call.
You want my services, you send me an offer like anybody else.
I would expect nothing less, Mandalorian.
Any time you need someone to make room for you at the top, you give me a call.
You and me, Darth. Good team.
Just make sure your offer's competitive. This is a business after all.
I would expect nothing less.
The Empire doesn't own me.
Killing Jun Seros and the Supreme Chancellor was a matter of honor.
From here on, handle your own dirty work. I am my own man, Tormen.
From here on, handle your own dirty work. I am my own woman, Tormen.
You may regret those words, Mandalorian.
You've gotten all the use you're gonna get out of me, Tormen.
You delivered on Jun Seros. I delivered on the Chancellor. We're done.
You may regret those words, bounty hunter.
The Jedi are broken; the Republic forces are in disarray. Now is the time to strike.
The noose is closing. All eyes are focused on the last stand of the Green Jedi. Now is the time to strike.
You will depart Corellia. Make for the Founder, the Supreme Chancellor's flagship. Immediately.
The Founder's landing codes will give the Republic fleet little reason to fire upon you.
Were the landing codes the only thing of worth?
Seros didn't have other intel?
Only the most relevant. The data retrieved from Jun Seros has proven invaluable.
You think they'll just let me fly right to the Supreme Chancellor?
It can't be that simple.
The Republic should expect deception. We must make things convincing.
Somehow, I'm not reassured.
I'd prefer "no reason."
The fate of this operation will not be left to the landing codes alone.
Captain Horn has prepared an SOS signal using the Republic's ciphers. When you leave the spaceport, you will be pursued by our ships.
The Republic will allow you to board, or they risk allowing one of their own to die. We will give them no time for doubt.
Will your pilots know I'm on their side?
Your people know it's an act?
Their orders will be to stop you at all costs.
Should make a good anecdote for the next time I see Mandalore.
Glory. I like it.
And here I thought you'd make this too easy for me.
High risk. I like it.
Do not hesitate to dispatch your pursuers if they become troublesome.
If you think I'm gonna let you shoot me down, you got another thing coming.
You think I'm expendable?
I expect you can handle it.
You will reach the Founder by any means necessary.
Once on board, your first priority will be to destroy all crafts in the adjacent hangars to prevent the Supreme Chancellor from escaping.
Does Seros's data specify what's docked in those hangars?
You have a total count?
Leave nothing to chance. Destroy anything capable of space flight.
Improvised demolition is one of my specialties.
Piece of cake.
Meanwhile, the Supreme Chancellor hits the nearest escape pod and sinks this plan before it's even started.
That's a waste of time.
It is unlikely he will risk using an unguided escape pod while the Empire dominates Corellia. The hangars are his only hope.
With no means of escape, only the Supreme Guard will stand between you and your prey.
I'm ready to depart for the Founder at anytime.
Let's do this.
Once the deed is done, how do you expect me to break away from the Republic fleet?
Speaking of making a getaway.
Signal your success, and the Tyrant will lead an attack to cover your escape.
Time to see if the Supreme Guard live up to their name.
Fancy title for guards.
I will await you on the Tyrant.
The Supreme Chancellor's fate is sealed.
My lord, control of the ship has been restored. I've assumed command for the time being.
My--my lord! It's a relief to see you unscathed.
Where is Captain Evlen?
Killed in the defense of the bridge, my lord.
And yet, you live.
We were overwhelmed, my lord, we--
I--he--the captain's dead, sir--my lord.
And yet, you avoided his fate.
Yes--I mean--no, we were surr--
Eee! Blizz not look! Blizz not want to see! Boss hide Blizz!
If I sell you out, it's gonna be to that guy... just saying.
Hmph. Let 'im try it with his bare hands.
Ouch.
Well, I'm not sleeping tonight.
I have you to thank for a ship.
You wanted to discuss Corellia.
Let's just get to business.
That's right.
The captain promised me compensation.
It wasn't a favor.
You'll inherit his wages.
You can add this to my bill.
This wasn't a favor.
So be it.
Have this ship operational by the time we are finished.
I am mobilizing my entire division to Corellia. Their rebellion will be crushed. Corellia will fall, but military victory will not be enough.
I do not want the Republic merely defeated. They must submit.
And a corpse can't grovel. I get it. Who do you want?
So you need prisoners.
A win's a win.
I don't see the difference.
We will not make martyrs. The people will see their heroes broken and their Republic fail them.
You pay me enough, I'll get them to sing.
I'm sure that can be arranged.
Capture will suffice.
There is a massive resistance supporting the Republic's defense of Corellia. You will secure the rebel leaders. I will make them kneel.
When the rebellion bows before Corellia's rightful leaders, our trap will be set.
What happens once this trap is sprung?
Give me the specifics.
What's the rebellion got to do with Jun Seros and the Supreme Chancellor?
How's this relate to our deal?
If Corellia is conquered, the Republic will send troops. If Corellia secedes, the Republic must rely on diplomacy.
Assuming you break them.
Hardly a sure bet.
Their limits will not be tested; they will be shattered.
A compact will be signed, publicly. Corellia's governor will demand the Supreme Chancellor ratify the treaty and withdraw Republic forces.
The Supreme Chancellor will have to acknowledge that the Corellians have chosen Imperial rule, but not before Jun Seros convinces him that his Jedi can turn the tide.
I've only seen Seros operate through proxies.
Seros might not show.
He was undefeated on every front he led during the last war. He will not sit idle while Corellia falls.
It's worth a shot.
Seros shows his face; I blow it off. When do we start?
Then he's mine.
Immediately.
I have sent my forces ahead, under command of General Krau. Meet with him and proceed according to plan.
When the Tyrant is hyperspace capable, I will join you.
I have word that the privateer and Kuati woman have been dealt with.
The prompt payment was appreciated.
They were nice bounties.
My subordinates tell me you've dealt with the privateer and Kuati woman.
There's nothing keeping the plan from moving forward.
That's right.
Good.
Lieutenant Horn and the ambassador were a great help.
Thanks to their assistance.
Noted.
When do I get my hands on Jun Seros?
We done with these sidelines?
Soon.
The campaign on Rabaan is coming to a close. I will direct my forces toward a full-scale assault on Corellia.
Rendezvous with my flagship, the Tyrant, in Rabaan's out-system.
